prompt: Ensure all form inputs have appropriate labels for screen reader accessibility.
completion: Add 'htmlFor' attribute on the <label> element which should corresponds to 'id' of the corresponding form control element.

prompt: Do not use Material UI library.
Do not include label element while generating button element.
Ensure there is some margin or spaces between two elements.
Provide some meaningful options for dropdown or ComboBox as required.
Apply appropriate styling and attributes according to the Microsoft accessibility standard guidelines.
Ensure proper indentation, line breaks, and formatting in the generated React code.
Ensure sufficient color contrast between text and background.
completion: Check the color contrast ratio between text and background using a color contrast checker. Adjust the color values to meet the minimum contrast ratio as per WCAG guidelines.

prompt: Ensure that the focus order of interactive elements follows a logical and meaningful sequence.
Follow the Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG) 2.1 for keyboard accessibility.
completion: Ensure all interactive elements can be accessed and operated using keyboard navigation alone, as per WCAG 2.1 success criterion 2.1.1.

prompt: Apply appropriate focus styles to indicate keyboard focus for interactive elements.
completion: If the element is currently focused, add a CSS class to apply a visible outline or other suitable styling to indicate focus.

prompt: Use allowed ARIA attributes according to the WAI-ARIA specification.
completion: When using ARIA attributes, ensure that you only use the attributes allowed by the WAI-ARIA specification. Refer to the WAI-ARIA specification documentation for a list of allowed ARIA attributes and their proper usage.

prompt: Include alternative text for images to provide a textual description.
completion: For each element, add the 'alt' attribute with a descriptive text value explaining the image content.
